Apple___Apple_scab.description: Fungal disease causing dark, scabby lesions on leaves and fruit.

steps.action: Remove infected leaves and fallen debris
Spray neem oil solution (2 tbsp per gallon)

treatments.name: Captan Fungicide

steps.action: Mix captan fungicide per label instructions
Spray thoroughly on all leaf surfaces

safety_warnings: Do not harvest for 14 days after application

prevention.action: Rake and destroy fallen leaves in autumn

Apple___Black_rot.description: Fungal disease causing dark, sunken lesions on fruit and leaf spots.

treatments.name: Copper Spray
safety_warnings: Copper can accumulate in soil with overuse

steps.action: Repeat every 10 days during wet weather

prevention.action: Remove dead wood and mummies annually

Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.description: Fungal disease causing bright orange spots on leaves.

treatments.name: Sulfur Spray

steps.action: Remove nearby juniper/cedar trees if possible
Repeat every 7 days during wet periods

safety_warnings: Do not apply sulfur in temperatures above 85¬∞F

steps.action: Repeat at bloom and petal fall

Apple___healthy.description: No disease detected. Your apple plant looks healthy!

Blueberry___healthy.description: No disease detected. Your blueberry plant looks healthy!

Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.description: White powdery coating on leaves and shoots.

steps.action: Apply at first sign of disease
Rotate with non-host crops for 1-2 years

Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.description: Small reddish-brown pustules on both leaf surfaces.

steps.action: Plan resistant hybrids for next season
Apply mancozeb at first sign of pustules

prevention.action: Plant early to avoid peak rust season

Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.description: Long elliptical gray-green lesions on leaves.

steps.action: Ensure good coverage of upper leaves

Grape___Black_rot.description: Brown circular lesions on leaves; fruit shrivels into hard mummies.

steps.action: Improve canopy air flow via pruning

treatments.name: Myclobutanil
safety_warnings: Rotate fungicide classes to prevent resistance

prevention.action: Remove mummies and infected canes during dormancy

Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).description: Tiger-stripe pattern on leaves; dark spotting on berries.

Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.description: Dark brown spots with yellow halos on leaves.

prevention.action: Ensure good air circulation in vineyard

Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).description: Bacterial disease causing yellow shoots, lopsided fruit, and tree decline.

steps.action: Maintain healthy root system with compost
Control Asian citrus psyllid with kaolin clay

treatments.name: Imidacloprid (psyllid control)

steps.action: Apply systemic insecticide to control psyllid vector

safety_warnings: Harmful to pollinators; apply when bees are not active

Peach___Bacterial_spot.description: Small dark lesions on leaves and fruit; leaves may drop early.

steps.action: Apply copper hydroxide at leaf fall
Repeat in early spring before bud break
Repeat every 5-7 days during wet weather

Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.description: Water-soaked lesions on leaves that turn brown; fruit spots.

treatments.name: Streptomycin + Copper

steps.action: Rotate with mancozeb to prevent resistance

safety_warnings: Use only as directed on label

Potato___Early_blight.description: Dark concentric ring lesions (target spots) on lower leaves.

steps.action: Mulch around plants to prevent soil splash

Potato___Late_blight.description: Water-soaked lesions that turn brown-black; white mold on undersides.

treatments.name: Metalaxyl + Mancozeb

steps.action: Follow up with mancozeb every 5-7 days

safety_warnings: Act quickly; this disease can destroy crops in days

prevention.action: Plant resistant varieties; destroy volunteer potatoes
Hill soil around plants for tuber protection

Squash___Powdery_mildew.description: White powdery patches on leaf surfaces.

Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.description: Small purple spots that enlarge; leaves appear scorched.

steps.action: Mow and thin plants after harvest
Apply captan in spring at first leaf growth

Tomato___Bacterial_spot.description: Small dark spots on leaves and fruit; leaves may yellow.

steps.action: Repeat every 5-7 days during wet weather

Tomato___Early_blight.description: Concentric ring (target) spots on lower leaves, progressing upward.

prevention.action: Stake plants and remove suckers for air flow

Tomato___Late_blight.description: Large water-soaked patches; white mold under leaves; rapid plant death.

steps.action: Apply copper preventatively to healthy plants

treatments.name: Metalaxyl (Ridomil)
safety_warnings: Act immediately; delays can lose entire crop

prevention.action: Avoid overhead watering; use resistant varieties

Tomato___Leaf_Mold.description: Pale green to yellow spots on upper leaves; olive-green mold beneath.

treatments.name: Chlorothalonil
safety_warnings: Ensure good coverage on leaf undersides

Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.description: Many small circular spots with dark borders and gray centers on lower leaves.

steps.action: Repeat every 7 days during rainy periods

Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.description: Tiny mites causing stippled yellow leaves and fine webbing.

steps.action: Spray plants with strong water jet
Apply neem oil or insecticidal soap

treatments.name: Abamectin Miticide

steps.action: Repeat after 7 days for egg hatch

safety_warnings: Avoid broad-spectrum insecticides that kill predators

prevention.action: Keep plants well-watered; mites thrive in dry conditions

Tomato___Target_Spot.description: Small brown spots with concentric rings on leaves and fruit.

prevention.action: Increase plant spacing for air flow

Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.description: Upward leaf curling, yellowing, stunted growth; spread by whiteflies.

treatments.name: Whitefly Control

steps.action: Place yellow sticky traps for whiteflies
Use reflective mulch to repel whiteflies

safety_warnings: No cure for virus; manage vector

treatments.name: Imidacloprid (vector control)

steps.action: Remove infected plants to reduce virus source

safety_warnings: Harmful to bees; apply at base, not on flowers

prevention.action: Use TYLCV-resistant varieties; use row covers

Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.description: Mottled light/dark green leaves; distorted growth.

treatments.name: Sanitation + Removal

steps.action: Wash hands before handling other plants

safety_warnings: Highly contagious through touch; no cure

steps.action: No chemical treatment available for viruses

prevention.action: Use resistant varieties; sterilize all tools

Tomato___healthy.description: No disease detected. Your tomato plant looks healthy!
